You can also use Google Tag Manager and a dataLayer to capture events and then it can be pushed upstack to Google Analytics and / or any other tools, just as easy:

dataLayer.push({’event’:’myEvent’,’eventCategory’:’ABC’,’eventAction’:’DEF’,’eventLabel’:’GHI’});

The other thing to consider is using Custom Dimensions to enrich your events, for example, with a User Id (to identify the user), the Client Id (the internal Analytics Id) or other attributes, for example whether its a blog page, product page etc. Custom Metrics can be used to capture if its a Brochure Download, Sign In, Video View, Feature Request.

The nice thing about capturing a Client Id and / or User Id is you can then use the Measurement Protocol to embed follow on hits which may take place within an app or offline process ðŸ™‚
